Name: geothermal_energy_potential
Title: Geothermal Energy Potential
Description: Thermal conductivity is the ability of a ground to conduct heat from one location to another without the movement of the soil conducting the heat. It is expressed in watts per meter kelvin (W/mK). The thermal diffusivity is a measure that represents how fast heat diffuses through the soil. It is measured as mm2/sec. The two models were calculated using remote sensing data  (Sentinel-1, Sentinel-3) and interpolated ground data  (bulk density, soil texture, slope DEM, organic content, land use map, natura2000) by applying a model of water distribution to the first meter of the soil profile. The thermal conductivity layer was calculated for the whole Austria for 2024 and 2025.
